normalised: ## Catching Lightning in a Bottle: Decoding Virality Trends in Social Media

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Ever wondered why that random video of a Lucknow auto driver singing Bollywood classics explodes, while your meticulously planned campaign falls flatter than a dosa? That's the magic (and mystery!) of virality.
normalised: Hey everyone! Ever wondered why that random video of a Lucknow auto driver singing Bollywood classics explodes, while your meticulously planned campaign falls flatter than a dosa? That's the magic and mystery of virality.

unnormalised: Understanding virality trends in the ever-evolving world of social media is like trying to predict the Mumbai monsoon – unpredictable, but with a few patterns you can (hopefully) decipher.
normalised: Understanding virality trends in the ever evolving world of social media is like trying to predict the Mumbai monsoon, unpredictable, but with a few patterns you can hopefully decipher.

unnormalised: Right now, authenticity is HUGE. People are tired of perfectly curated feeds. They want to see real stories, real struggles, and real successes. Think about it: that video of Priya aunty making her famous biryani (the one she claims is a family secret passed down since 1857!) resonated more than any ad featuring a celebrity chef. Why? Because it felt genuine.

unnormalised: Another massive trend is short-form video. Thanks, TikTok! Reels, Shorts – these bite-sized pieces of content are perfect for our shrinking attention spans. And memes! Oh, the memes! Capitalizing on trending memes, especially those rooted in Indian culture, is a surefire way to boost engagement. Remember that "Rasode mein kaun tha?" meme? Absolute gold!

unnormalised: But here's the thing: what goes viral today might be old news tomorrow. The internet moves at warp speed. A trend might peak at 14:00 hrs on a Tuesday and be completely forgotten by Wednesday morning.
normalised: But here's the thing: what goes viral today might be old news tomorrow. The internet moves at warp speed. A trend might peak at fourteen hundred hours on a Tuesday and be completely forgotten by Wednesday morning.

unnormalised: So, how do you stay ahead of the curve? Keep your ear to the ground (or rather, your eyes glued to your feed!). Follow influencers who are trendsetters, not just followers. And most importantly, don't be afraid to experiment! Try different formats, different topics, and see what resonates with your audience.
